Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: அறவினை யாதெனின் கொல்லாமை கோறல்பிறவினை எல்லாந் தரும்.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: Never to destroy life is the sum of all virtuous conduct. The destruction of life leads to every evil.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A split composition illustrating the ultimate virtue and vice.
Layered_Composition.Midground: On the right, the act of 'not killing' ('கொல்லாமை') is depicted. From this single act of compassion, a magnificent, all-encompassing tree of pure, white light grows, representing the 'sum of all virtues' ('அறவினை').
Layered_Composition.Background: On the left, the act of 'killing' ('கோறல்') is depicted. From this single act of violence, a dark, twisted, thorny portal to a hellish dimension opens, from which a horde of all other sins and evils ('பிற வினை எல்லாம்') pour forth.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: Not killing is the one act that constitutes all of virtue. Killing is the one act that gives birth to all other evils.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The tree of all virtues versus the portal of all evils is the central metaphor. Non-violence is presented as the singular, foundational good, while violence is the singular, foundational evil from which all others spring.
Art_Direction.Mood_and_Emotion: Foundational, ultimate good vs. ultimate evil, creative vs. destructive.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: The right side is bathed in a brilliant, pure, and life-giving white and golden light. The left side is a terrifying vortex of darkness, shadow, and hellish reds.

Technical_Cues.Camera: An epic, balanced diptych that shows the two foundational acts and their cosmic consequences.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, ultra-realistic, with ethereal effects for the tree of virtue and terrifying effects for the portal of evil.
Technical_Cues.Lighting: Extreme high-contrast lighting to represent the absolute moral dichotomy.
Technical_Cues.Art_Genre: Epic fantasy art, with a strong moral framework.

Cultural_Anchors: What is virtuous action? Not killing. (அறவினை யாதெனின் கொல்லாமை)
